Description: Bronze lamp with a rounded body and a long flat-topped nozzle with a rounded tip and circular wick-hole, set off from the body by jogs. At the rear is a ring handle, largely lost, together with most of the ornament above it. On the left side is a lion's head with a suspension-lug below. The filling-hole is surrounded by a moulded rim. The raised circular base-ring is concave within. There is a split dint in the left side.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3542)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
